content.description: Very fun climb with a great view. This climb is the farthest to the left on New Directions Cliff. Starts behind a tree and climbs a 20 wide face and arête on the right. Finishes with a small bowl with 2 rap rings for rappeling. Use 2 60m ropes to rap down. I used an 80m rope to lead, and rap to the bottom. I suggest this route for new climbers or new leaders.
content.protection: 10 quickdraws are 'needed', but you can skip several bolts as the route is well protected with lots of jugs, and finger crimps at the arete. Someone added several bolts to the left to end up on top of the rock.
content.location: This climb is the farthest to the left on New Directions Cliff. Starts behind a tree and climbs a 20 wide face and arête on the right.

content.description: Follow the arete of white rock on the left of New Directions Cliff, first up a thin corner, then up face holds, up the larger crack to the left of the Rusty Nail bolts, and ends at the belay station for Rusty Nail.
content.location: Several feet left of Rusty Nail.
